channel.title: ERC827 on SECBIT Blog
channel.description: Recent content in ERC827 on SECBIT Blog

item.title: Lacking Insights in ERC223 & ERC827 Implementation
item.description: This bug originates from a common practice: calling an arbitrary function appointed by the contract caller from another contract after invoking a function in the current one, while the bug in ATN contract reveals the danger of this approach: the contract caller could bypass authority checks or attack others with the identity of contract itself via this feature.
